title: Shortening Charging Cycles Of Electric Vehicles Is Key To Increasing Adoption
text: Though the electric vehicle (EV) segment has seen a steady gain in adoption numbers over the last decade, there are a few elementary issues that the industry needs to confront before it looks to take on its bigger adversary – internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles.

title: Weak Debut For Ship Lessor CSSC Shipping On Hong Kong's Stock Exchange
text: Shipyard-affiliated leasing company CSSC (Hong Kong) Shipping debuted on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (HKEX: 3877) yesterday morning at a price of HK$1.34 (US$0.17) raising HK$1,975 million (US$255 million).

title: ECB Hints for More Stimulus
text: Working off their highest closes since the first week of May, U.S. market indexes are ramping up yet again in today’s pre-market, giving hope they may finish this Friday up for the third week in a row.

title: How The Fed Could Upset The Dow Jones Index On Wednesday
text: Wall Street expects three quarter-point rate cuts by the end of the year. If the Fed keeps a neutral policy bias on Wednesday, the Dow Jones may take a hit.

title: Loonie little changed, pares earlier drop as oil price rallies
text: The Canadian dollar was little changed on Tuesday, paring earlier losses after slipping to a two-week low against the greenback, as a rally in oil prices offset domestic data showing an unexpected drop in April manufacturing sales.

title: Charitable giving dropped last year in the wake of the new tax law
text: Charitable giving by individuals America fell 1.1% to $292 billion in 2018 from 2017, according to Giving USA.

title: Dow surges 350 points as Trump tweets of 'extended meeting' with President Xi on trade
text: U.S. stocks took a fresh leg higher Tuesday morning after President Donald tweeted that he had a productive call| with Chinese President Xi Jinping related to tariffs. "Had a very good telephone conversation with President Xi of China.

title: Wall St. opens at six-week high on hopes of dovish Fed
text: U.S. stocks opened at their highest level in six-weeks on Tuesday, with Nasdaq leading the charge, as dovish calls from the European Central Bank raised expectations of a similar accommodative stance from the Federal Reserve.

title: Dow jumps 270 points in early action as Draghi comments spark fresh hope for Fed rate cuts
text: U.S. stocks on Tuesday climbed, extending Monday's gains, as investors awaited the start of the Federal Reserve's two-day policy meeting, set to kick off later Tuesday morning.

title: Exclusive: U.S. seen open to 'enforceable mechanism' to end aircraft subsidy spat
text: The United States is expected to be open to negotiations on an "enforceable mechanism" that could allow European planemaker Airbus to receive government funding on commercial terms and ease the risk of tit-for-tat sanctions, two U.S. sources said.

title: Fed Rate Cut: It's Not What You Think
text: The Fed is unlikely to cut rates once and leave it be. Like roaches, there is rarely just one.

title: Capitol Report: How S&P 500 CEOs are spending their own money on Democratic presidential hopefuls
text: It’s still early days in the fight to become the Democratic Party’s 2020 presidential nominee, but a few CEOs of S&P 500 companies already have been voting for their favorites with their wallets.

title: ECB Could Be Getting Set To Cut Interest Rates
text: The European Central Bank could see rate cuts as a toolkit for new stimulus. On Tuesday, the European stock market recovered from early falls as ECB President Mario Draghi promised more monetary stimulus if the economy does not improve.

title: Rick Santelli's 5 things you need to know about investing in bonds
text: If you want a balanced portfolio, experts say you should invest in bonds. Here are the answers to five key questions about the market, from CNBC's Rick Santelli.

title: US housing starts fall in May, but starts for the prior two months were revised higher
text: Housing starts fell in May, but building permits increased, suggesting that the housing market was drawing some support from a sharp decline in mortgage rates.

title: A Fed rate cut would ‘kick-start’ economic growth and lead to new market highs, Wall Street bull Tony Dwyer says
text: If the Federal Reserve fails to signal on Wednesday a rate cut, the June rally could hit the skids,Wall Street bull Tony Dwyer warns.

title: Capitalism vs Climate Change: The Venture Capitalists' Perspective

title: Here's how advisors can recommend a life insurance policy in their client's best interest
text: If you're making life insurance and annuity recommendations in the Empire State, you'll soon be required to act in your client's best interest. What you should know about this new rule.

title: Rothy's, the women's shoe brand with a cult-like following, is opening more stores
text: Rothy's will open five stores in cities including New York and Boston this fall and promises more are coming in 2020.

title: All-electric commuter plane unveiled at Paris Air Show — with a US airline as its first customer
text: The Israeli start-up Eviation announced at the Paris Air Show that U.S regional airline Cape Air is to buy its electric aircraft.

title: Draghi shock hits euro, boosts stocks
text: European shares rallied and the euro took a sharp hit on Tuesday in a knee-jerk reaction to European Central Bank President Mario Draghi's comments indicating a possibility of new rate cuts or asset purchases.

title: Euro drops, global equities rise as ECB's Draghi hits of more stimulus
text: The euro fell against the dollar on Tuesday, while European stocks and U.S. stock futures rose after European Central Bank President Mario Draghi indicated the bank is ready for more stimulus if the euro-area economy doesn't improve, at a conference in Portugal.

title: Former Snap exec Imran Khan takes aim at Amazon as retail site Verishop goes live
text: Imran Khan's retail website, Verishop, is going live on Tuesday. It sells a mix of designer apparel, home goods and beauty products from brands including Levi's and Boll & Branch.

title: Stocks Dip, Bonds Gain With Focus On Central Banks: Markets Wrap
text: Stocks fell in Europe alongside U.S. equity-index futures as all eyes turned toward meetings of the world’s biggest central banks.

title: ECB's Draghi defends policy tools and says it has further room to act
text: European Central Bank President Mario Draghi defended the tools that the organization has available.

title: Trade War: What to Expect From the G20 Summit
text: As the world's largest economies get set to meet at the G20 summit, all eyes will be on the U.S and China as the two countries look to settle their trade disputes.

title: Asia stocks edge up cautiously as Fed jitters build, Europe seen lower
text: Most Asian stock markets rose on Tuesday but gains were capped by investor caution ahead of a U.S. Federal Reserve policy decision, while crude oil prices dipped as global growth worries overshadowed supply concerns.

title: Two European countries could be the big winners from the US-China trade war, Barclays says
text: France and Germany could be the biggest beneficiaries in an escalation in trade tariffs between the U.S. and China, Barclays economists have projected.

title: Iran And Saudi Arabia Make Surprise Investments Close To Each Other In Australia
text: Iran and Saudi Arabia have chosen Australia for their latest investment international investments which are aimed at diversifying away from oil

text: Market focus is largely attuned to the U.S. central bank, with policymakers set to begin a two-day meeting later on Tuesday.

title: These Asian economies may be most badly hit by slowing global trade
text: Tensions between China and the U.S. are threatening to slow global trade further, threatening some Asian economies.

title: Wacom Bamboo Ink Plus adds tilt, rechargeable battery to its repertoire
text: Wacom's second generation of its Windows Ink stylus offers some refinements that should make it better and more reliable than before.
